required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Laser Therapy on Hamstring Muscle Among Young Adults
clinical_study.official_title: High-intensity Laser Therapy on Hamstring Muscle Length Among Young Adults

lead_sponsor.agency: Maharishi Markendeswar University (Deemed to be University)

clinical_study.source: Maharishi Markendeswar University (Deemed to be University)

brief_summary.textblock: A total of 154 healthy young individuals will be recruited by purposive sampling method to participate in a randomized, single-blinded, sham-controlled study. Recruited participants will be randomly dividing into two groups, the Active high-intensity laser therapy (a-HILT) group, and the Sham high-intensity laser therapy (s-HILT) group. The treatment duration will be 10 minutes per session on both lower limbs for each day for 3 days/week for 2 weeks. Hamstring muscle length will be assessed at baseline, end of the 2-week post-intervention period.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes will be measured at baseline, end of two week post intervention
primary_outcome.description: Active knee extension test (AKET) is most reliable method to assess the hamstring tightness.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes will be measured at baseline, end of two week post intervention
primary_outcome.description: Sit and toe touch test is used to assess the hamstring flexibility

arm_group.description: 77 participants will receive active high-intensity laser therapy interventions on hamstring muscle to improve the flexibility of muscle
77 participants will receive sham high-intensity laser therapy on hamstring muscle

intervention.description: High-intensity laser therapy will be used in the contact method, with the laser beam irradiated over the hamstring muscle. Dosage and parameters for the laser will be calculated. Parameters- Wavelength- 980 nm Intensity/Power density- 3W/cm2 Emission mode- Continuous Emission Energy (Joules)- 490 J Irradiation time- 70 Sec on each point Peak power- 15 Watt Irradiation points- 09
Sham High-intensity laser therapy will be used in the contact method, without the laser beam irradiation over the hamstring muscle.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Asymptomatic young adults
- Both gender
- Tightness of hamstring muscles
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any other musculoskeletal disorder
- Any disc pathology
- Any nerve root irritation
- Any surgical history or trauma
- Malignancy
- Pregnancy
- Sensory dysfunctions
- Cardiac pacemaker
